posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
You know....after that I have played as a bard for the first time, I really had a hard time playing pure melee characters.
Besides, after reading the bard guide posted by Mick Dagger, I really wanted to play a power bard: one that can not only support his teammates, but can also be on the front line (well, maybe not always: stronger meelers have the precedence ).

I was wandering on the old ECB guild archives, in order to obtain some ideas: after some time spent "flicking" these pages, Grizzled Dwarflord suggested the split "Bard23/CoT16/Cleric1". I began working on this build, and after some drafting (and many advices from you all, thanks!) two versions of this build have been produced (with and without devastating critical).

Note: as suggested, the INT of the devastating critical version has been lowered to gain one Strenght point and compensate the loss of a "Great strength" feat to make room for "Great cleave" feat; this change is valid for only solo plays, as Taunt has ben sacrificed (this skill has to be maintained for party play).

Advantages:
  • Lasting Inspiration;
  • Divine damage, granted by Divine Might and Divine Wrath;
  • AC boosted also by Divine Shield;
  • With Animal Domain, Bard can Summon Level VII beasties;
  • With Healing Domain, the Bard Cures are Empowered;
  • Undispellable bard spells (except for Mord's);
  • Good saves (taking into consideration the bonus provided by spellcraft);
  • Devastating critical (DC=40)

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: In the Dev Crit version, you could have taken Blind Fight at 9 (dropping the extra Weapon Focus), and Great Cleave at 14, allowing Great Strength at 21, and allowing you to keep 14 INT and Taunt.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote: In the Dev Crit version, you could have taken Blind Fight at 9 (dropping the extra Weapon Focus)
You need a WF for CoT, and you don't have WP Martial yet. If you take WP Martial instead to be able to take WF scimitar, you gain nothing, but lose the extra WF.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Aquarius 233 wrote: Bard(24), Champion of Torm(14), Cleric(2), Human
Cudos to creativity and originality!

It is not often you see Cleric 2, just for taking DM, and DS. Paladin/Blackguard 4 is common because of the charisma synergy to saves that those classes offer charisma builds. But here the 2 cleric levels fit perfectly with 24 bard levels for indispellability and 14 CoT levels for +7 to saves and an extra epic bonus feat.  Not to mention the alignment issues Paladins have with Bard.

It makes me happy that you give my Bard guide credit. <3

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
This build is a breath of fresh air after a long time and the name is evocative and fits perfectly to the theme!

I like that this Bard has almost no disadvantages, bringing in both defence & offence married to a powerful set of skills.

posts.content:
Mick Dagger wrote:
Empyre65 wrote: In the Dev Crit version, you could have taken Blind Fight at 9 (dropping the extra Weapon Focus)
You need a WF for CoT, and you don't have WP Martial yet. If you take WP Martial instead to be able to take WF scimitar, you gain nothing, but lose the extra WF.
Well, that's a foolish mistake for me to make. I guess that if you wanted to make a version with Taunt for party play, Knockdown is the feat to lose, reluctantly.
